item description: Given a real-world context, determine the unit rate.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Graph the solution set of an inequality on a number line.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. Recognize that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions; represent solutions of such inequalities on number line diagrams.

item description: Create an expression that can be used to find the surface area of a net consisting of rectangles and triangles.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface areas of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Given the coordinates of the vertices of a triangle, determine the length of a side.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Analyze a graph to determine the unit rate in a real-world context.
Cluster: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. For example, in a problem involving motion at constant speed, list and graph ordered pairs of distances and times, and write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

item description: Given one factor, determine a possible product by using common factors and common multiples in a real-world context.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Use prime factorization to find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two relatively prime numbers. For example, express 36 + 8 as 4(9 + 2).

item description: Find the volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths by completely filling them with unit cubes.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Create and solve equations that represent a given real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

item description: Use ratios to solve a real-world problem involving a given rate.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Using the context of improper fractions and decimals, determine which rational number is less than a given rational number.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Select ratios that correctly describe given ratio relationships in a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Determine which expression can be used to represent a given situation with real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.

item description: Determine a ratio, given a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Find and describe the median, mode, and mean of a data set; then given the mean, determine the value of an unknown number in another data set.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Given a diagram and a verbal description, determine the volume of a rectangular prism.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Identify equivalent expressions by using the Distributive Property.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Determine if expressions with exponents are equivalent to a given value.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

item description: Match ordered pairs to points on a coordinate plane and determine which ordered pair represents the image of a point after a reflection.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description:
Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

item description: Determine the volume of a solid by using rate and ratio reasoning within a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine which expression represents a real-world problem involving division of a fraction by a fraction.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.
Standard Description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.

item description: Determine whether the given division equations are true or false.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

item description: Evaluate an expression using substitution.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Using ratio and proportional reasoning, solve real-world problems involving fractions, decimals, percentages, and whole numbers.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine which graphical representation does not represent a given ratio.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine the mean and the mode of a given data set.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution, which can be described by its center (median, mean, and/or mode), spread (range, interquartile range), and overall shape.

item description: Determine the value of a given point on a number line.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description:
Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

item description: Solve a two-step equation for an unknown value.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: Which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

item description: Determine which box plot represents a given set of data and interpret a box plot to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

item description: Solve a word problem with real-world context using division of mixed numbers by mixed numbers.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.
Standard Description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.

item description: Determine which mathematical expression can be used to represent a given situation with real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.

item description: Order absolute value expressions from least to greatest value.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Solve a two-step equation to find the value of an unknown quantity.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: Which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

item description: Determine which points on a coordinate plane have a given distance between them.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

item description: Solve a real-world problem involving volumes of right rectangular prisms.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Given an equation of the form px = q, select the equation that is equivalent to the given equation.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

item description: Determine the unit rate given a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Determine the product of multi-digit decimals to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

item description: Determine the measures of center associated with a given set of data.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.

item description: Determine which expressions are equivalent to a given expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them). For example, the expressions y + y + y and 3y are equivalent because they name the same number regardless of which number y stands for.

item description: Given the value of one variable, determine the value of another variable by analyzing the relationship of data shown on a coordinate plane.
Cluster: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. For example, in a problem involving motion at constant speed, list and graph ordered pairs of distances and times, and write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

item description: Determine the value of an expression given the value of a variable.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Interpret inequalities using absolute values of integers.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Find the quotient of two multi-digit numbers.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

item description: Find the greatest common factor of two numbers to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Use prime factorization to find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two relatively prime numbers. For example, express 36 + 8 as 4(9 + 2).

item description: Solve a ratio problem based on a given real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Solve problems on a coordinate plane by plotting points, finding the distance between points, and finding the coordinates of points given the distance between them.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Graph a negative decimal on a number line.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description:
Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

item description: Create a histogram to represent a given set of data.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

item description: Determine the value of the variable in an inequality.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: Which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

item description: Identify multiple statistical questions.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers. For example, “How old am I?” is not a statistical question, but “How old are the students in my school?” is a statistical question because one anticipates variability in students’ ages.

item description: Solve a unit-rate problem based on a given real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Identify expressions that are equivalent to a given variable expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them). For example, the expressions y + y + y and 3y are equivalent because they name the same number regardless of which number y stands for.

item description: Calculate the quotient of two fractions.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.
Standard Description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.

item description: Solve a real-world problem by interpreting and finding ratios based on a given ratio relationship.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Graph on a number line an inequality that represents a constraint in a given real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. Recognize that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions; represent solutions of such inequalities on number line diagrams.

item description: Determine which equation represents a given real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

item description: Determine which expression can be used to represent a real-world context and use it to complete sentences about the context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.

item description: Determine the median and mean of a set of data.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Choose a two-variable equation that best represents a given real-world context.
Cluster: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. For example, in a problem involving motion at constant speed, list and graph ordered pairs of distances and times, and write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

item description: Evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

item description: Add and subtract decimals within a real-world context.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

item description: Determine the unit rate within a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Calculate the mean of a given set of data.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Write and solve equations that model a real-world problem.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

item description: Identify the ratios that represent the relationships between given quantities.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Use the distributive property to generate an equivalent expression within a real-world context.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Identify the inequality which represents a constraint within a real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. Recognize that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions; represent solutions of such inequalities on number line diagrams.

item description: Use the distributive property to determine equivalent expressions given a variable expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Find the area of a right triangle and decompose a polygon into triangles to complete sentences about its area.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine which statement describes a given ratio relationship in a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Determine the interquartile range of data displayed in a box plot.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution, which can be described by its center (median, mean, and/or mode), spread (range, interquartile range), and overall shape.

item description: Use properties of operations to identify an equivalent equation.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Determine the volume of a liquid by using rate and ratio reasoning within a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Identify multiple statistical questions.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers. For example, “How old am I?” is not a statistical question, but “How old are the students in my school?” is a statistical question because one anticipates variability in students’ ages.

item description: Solve problems on a coordinate plane by finding the distance between points, plotting points, and finding the coordinates of a point given its distance from a different point.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

item description: Determine whether given real-world situations can be best represented by positive or negative numbers.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values (e.g., temperature above/below zero, elevation above/below sea level, credits/debits, and positive/negative electric charge). Use positive and negative numbers (whole numbers, fractions, and decimals) to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of zero in each situation.

item description: Use the net of a square pyramid to find its surface area.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface areas of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Compare unit rates given a ratio in a real-world context involving money.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine which statements correctly describe data represented in a dot plot.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Determine the number of cubes with fractional edge lengths that would fit in a given right rectangular prism in a real-world context.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Use the unit rate from a table to solve a real-world problem involving ratios.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Graph a quadrilateral given the coordinates of the vertices.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine which part/part or part/whole ratios represent a given real-world situation.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Given a dot plot representing a real-world context, answer questions related to measures of center and distribution of the data.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Identify two ordered pairs represented on a coordinate plane.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description:
Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. Recognize that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions; represent solutions of such inequalities on number line diagrams.

item description: Find the area of a figure by decomposing it into triangles and rectangles.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Evaluate a numerical expression with exponents, using order of operations.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

item description: Determine unit rates in a real-world situation.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.

Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. For example, in a problem involving motion at constant speed, list and graph ordered pairs of distances and times, and write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

item description: Determine which statement describes a given ratio relationship in a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Write expressions using substitution and use the expressions to solve real-world problems.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Determine whether the given division equations involving multi-digit decimals are correct or not correct.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

item description: Solve a word problem with real-world context using division of mixed numbers by mixed numbers.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.
Standard Description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.

item description: Use ratio reasoning to convert between customary and metric measurement units in a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Order absolute value expressions from least to greatest value.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Recognize measures of center for a real-world situation.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.

item description: Use the net of a rectangular prism to find its surface area.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface areas of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Find the absolute value of a number.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Solve a ratio problem using conversion of units within a measurement system.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine the unit cost in a real-world situation.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Determine the mean and the mode of a given data set.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution, which can be described by its center (median, mean, and/or mode), spread (range, interquartile range), and overall shape.

item description: Given descriptions of real-world situations, determine whether the situations can be represented by part/part or part/whole ratios.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Solve a real-world problem involving volumes of right rectangular prisms.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine the quotient of a four-digit dividend and a two-digit divisor.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

item description: Determine the correct equation to model a real-world scenario, and use that equation to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

item description: Determine which questions are statistical questions.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers. For example, “How old am I?” is not a statistical question, but “How old are the students in my school?” is a statistical question because one anticipates variability in students’ ages.

item description: Identify the box plot that represents a set of data.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

item description: Represent the value of a given number as an expression with a whole-number exponent.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

item description: Find the area of a composite figure.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Identify the parts of a mathematical expression and evaluate the expression for a specific value.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Solve a unit rate problem based on a given real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Use the greatest common factor and least common multiple to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Use prime factorization to find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two relatively prime numbers. For example, express 36 + 8 as 4(9 + 2).

item description: Use rate reasoning to solve a real-world problem involving fractions.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Given a real-world context, find the possible values of the variable in an inequality.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: Which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

item description: Use the properties of operations to factor an expression into an equivalent expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Given an expression, select an equivalent expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them). For example, the expressions y + y + y and 3y are equivalent because they name the same number regardless of which number y stands for.

item description: Determine which expression is equivalent to a given expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them). For example, the expressions y + y + y and 3y are equivalent because they name the same number regardless of which number y stands for.

item description: Solve a two-step equation for an unknown value.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: Which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

item description: Create inequality statements with and without absolute values.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Determine the unit rate within a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Evaluate an expression using substitution.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Solve a real-world problem involving the volume of a right rectangular prism.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Create a histogram based on given data from a real-world situation.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

item description: Solve a real-world problem by dividing multi-digit numbers.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

item description: Identify the ratios that represent the relationships between given quantities.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Solve a real-world problem that involves finding the part given the percent and the whole.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine which expression is equivalent to a given variable expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them). For example, the expressions y + y + y and 3y are equivalent because they name the same number regardless of which number y stands for.

item description: Use the distributive property to determine equivalent expressions given a variable expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Determine the best measure of variability for a real-world situation.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.

item description: Write an expression that represents a given real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.

item description: Solve mathematical problems that involve decomposing a figure into a right triangle and a trapezoid to determine the total area of the figure.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Translate a given verbal expression to a numerical expression with exponents.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

item description: Identify multiple statistical questions.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers. For example, “How old am I?” is not a statistical question, but “How old are the students in my school?” is a statistical question because one anticipates variability in students’ ages.

item description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine which mathematical expression represents a verbal description.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Determine the mean for a set of data represented in a table.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Use the distributive property to determine which expressions in a table are equivalent to a given variable expression and which are not.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent (i.e., when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted into them). For example, the expressions y + y + y and 3y are equivalent because they name the same number regardless of which number y stands for.

item description: Use absolute value to determine the distance between two points on a coordinate plane given a mathematical context.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

item description: Identify the number of observations on a histogram.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, such as by:

item description: Identify multiple statistical questions.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers. For example, “How old am I?” is not a statistical question, but “How old are the students in my school?” is a statistical question because one anticipates variability in students’ ages.

item description: Create and evaluate expressions based on a real-world situation.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.

item description: Determine whether given division equations are true or false.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

item description: Identify a rational number that is within a range of other rational numbers.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

item description: Use the net of a triangular prism to find its surface area.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface areas of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine the value of a given point on a number line.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description:
Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

item description: Interpret the relationship between two variables and use the relationship to create an equation.
Cluster: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. For example, in a problem involving motion at constant speed, list and graph ordered pairs of distances and times, and write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

item description: Find the length of the side of a polygon by finding the distance between points on a coordinate plane.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine which histogram represents a given set of data.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

item description: Identify the location of a given point on a coordinate plane.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

item description: Using ratio and proportional reasoning, solve real-world problems involving fractions, decimals, percentages, and whole numbers.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Determine which ratios are equivalent to a given unit rate.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Determine the location of a point on a coordinate plane based on its distance from a given point.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

item description: Analyze a dot plot using median, mode, and range.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution, which can be described by its center (median, mean, and/or mode), spread (range, interquartile range), and overall shape.

item description: Identify expressions using mathematical terms such as sum, product, quotient, and difference.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Create a verbal description that represents a mathematical expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

item description: Determine the type of a polygon given the coordinates of its vertices.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Solve a real-world problem involving percentages.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Identify a missing coordinate given a description of a polygon graphed on the coordinate plane.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine the product of two multi-digit decimals.
Cluster: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.
Standard Description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

item description: Determine the volume of a liquid by using rate and ratio reasoning within a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: On a number line, graph the solution set that represents a constraint in a given real-world context.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. Recognize that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions; represent solutions of such inequalities on number line diagrams.

item description: Use the net of a cube to find its surface area.
Cluster: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Standard Description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface areas of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

item description: Determine the unit rate from a given real-world situation.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b not 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship, including the use of units.

item description: Write and solve equations that model a real-world problem.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q, and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

item description: Determine which part/part or part/whole ratios represent a given real-world situation.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Use the properties of operations to factor an expression into an equivalent expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Analyze a dot plot to find the median and range of the data.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution, which can be described by its center (median, mean, and/or mode), spread (range, interquartile range), and overall shape.

item description: Choose a two-variable equation that best represents a given real-world context shown in a graph.
Cluster: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. item description: Solve real-world problems by interpreting and using quotients of fractions, using geometry as a context.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.

item description: Determine the unit cost in a real-world situation.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.

item description: Solve a real-world problem to find the whole, given a part and the percent.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.

Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.

item description: Plot a rectangle on a coordinate plane, given the coordinates of its vertices.

item description: Solve a real-world problem involving positive and negative numbers.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values (e.g., temperature above/below zero, elevation above/below sea level, credits/debits, and positive/negative electric charge). Use positive and negative numbers (whole numbers, fractions, and decimals) to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of zero in each situation.

item description: Determine which values of a variable will make an inequality true.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: Which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

item description: Use the coordinate plane to determine the distance between two graphed points that have the same x-value.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

item description: Apply the Distributive Property to identify an equivalent expression.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions. For example, apply the distributive property to the expression 3(2 + x) to produce the equivalent expression 6 + 3x; apply the distributive property to the expression 24x + 18y to produce the equivalent expression 6(4x + 3y); apply properties of operations to y + y + y to produce the equivalent expression 3y.

item description: Find a unit price and use another unit price to solve a problem in a real-world context.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

item description: Interpret a circle graph to solve a real-world problem.
Cluster: Summarize and describe distributions.
Standard Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

item description: Given an expression with repeated multiplication, write an equivalent numerical expression with whole number exponents.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.
Standard Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

item description: Given descriptions of real-world situations, determine whether the situations can be represented by part/part or part/whole ratios.
Cluster: Understand ratio and rate concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
Standard Description: Understand the concept of a ratio including the distinctions between part:part and part:whole and the value of a ratio; part/part and part/whole. Use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

item description: Identify an ordered pair that represents the location of a point after a reflection over an axis of the coordinate plane.
Cluster: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.
Standard Description:
Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and
coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with
negative number coordinates.

item description: Determine which questions are statistical questions.
Cluster: Develop understanding of statistical variability.
Standard Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers. For example, “How old am I?” is not a statistical question, but “How old are the students in my school?” is a statistical question because one anticipates variability in students’ ages.

item description: Determine which expression can be used to represent a real-world situation.
Cluster: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.
Standard Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.
